sub_title: Advisor integrated approaches for sustainable development | Program & Project Manager
summary:
Advisor or project leader in multi-disciplinary inclusive development approaches, specialised in connecting economic development and ecosystem management aimed at climate resilient livelihoods, a healthy environment and food security. Based on values of equality and solidarity and a natural drive to search for opportunities for improvement, I'm dedicated to support better living conditions for the most vulnerable living in fragile areas. 

The key challenge for me is to promote sustainable economic development while strengthening ecosystem resilience. For this we need to work across silos and connect different disciplines. Considering the impact of economic actions in the wider landscape, and vice versa, considering the impact of landscape restoration on the livelihoods of local people, will allow selection of the best investment decisions with sustainable impact. 

I strongly believe in the power of collaboration and support multi-stakeholder participation for sustainable, inclusive and context-specific solutions. I stand for building on local capacities and subsidiarity. While local people own their development process and drive the change, together we can achieve more and strengthen each other’s capacities.

Experienced in leading multi-disciplinary teams to develop projects and approaches, implement projects and learn from practice. While delivering results, I promote qualitative improvement in process, approach and deliverables.

I'm analytical, but also pragmatic and able to translate theoretical concepts into applications.

Fields of expertise: rural livelihoods, disaster risk management, climate change adaptation, conflict risk reduction, ecosystem-based adaptation, adaptive programming, institutional development.

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

profile_positions.description: Reversing the Flow (RtF) supports communities in vulnerable situations by strengthening their water security. RtF aims at making communities more resilient with water and climate adaptation actions. Communities will organise and lead these actions themselves. Local partners will create hubs to support the communities.
profile_positions.title: Advisor Reversing the Flow

profile_positions.description:
As Program Manager Resilient Communities at Cordaid I contribute to strengthening the resilience of vulnerable communities to cope with natural hazards and climate change. The program applies an integrated approach combining disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, ecosystem management, sustainable livelihoods, water resources management, community organisation, preparedness and early warning systems. 

Responsibilities:
•	Coordination of project implementation including multi-party consortium projects and integrated projects with teams of national and international staff, combining technical experts, lobbyists, program managers, project officers and finance staff. For example, the Partners for Resilience Strategic Partnership.
•	Facilitation of multi-stakeholder processes for the development of resilience action plans for communities, districts, and water catchments. For example, the development of the Lokok and Lokere Catchment Management Plans in Uganda.
•	Technical assistance on integrating disaster risk management, ecosystem management & restoration and climate change adaptation (Integrated Risk Management) for a wide range of projects in Ethiopia, Kenya, South Sudan and Uganda, including:
1.	Advising on locally-led participatory approach for risk assessments, action planning, community organization, monitoring & evaluation, learning & documentation, identification of policy gaps and formulation of policy asks.
2. 	Supporting identification and design of resilience measures in the fields of agriculture, alternative livelihoods, natural resource management, access to water, credit & saving groups and disaster preparedness.

Other tasks include proposal development / acquisition, knowledge development and learning, institutional development of Country Offices and partner organisations, representation and communication of project results.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Resilient Communities

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the management of the project and partner portfolio for the Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) programs in East Africa. Tasks included assessment of proposals for funding, monitoring and evaluation of projects in implementation, reporting to donors, program development, communication about results to the Dutch public, assessment and capacity building of local partner organizations. 

Achievements (amongst others):
•	The start-up, implementation and management of the Cordaid and Partners for Resilience MFS2  programmes on Disaster Risk Reduction in Uganda, Kenya, South Sudan and Ethiopia.
•	The initiation of Cordaid’s Disaster Risk Reduction program in South Sudan (2011-2013). 
•	The development of a sub-catchment and district development plan for Dopeth Sub-Catchment and Kotido and Kabong Districts in Uganda. 
•	Development of the business plan for the Cordaid programme Building Resilient Livelihoods (2012-2016).
profile_positions.title: Program Officer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the financial assessment of new funding proposals, monitoring of financed projects and capacity building in the field of financial management of partner organizations in Colombia and Haiti within the program Reconstruction and Reconciliation which was part of the sector Emergency Aid and Reconstruction.
profile_positions.title: Financial Expert / Project Controller

profile_positions.description: In the aftermatch of the devastating earthquake which hit Haiti in 2010, I worked as interim Program Advisor. In this position I was responsible for assisting partner organisations in proposal writing and implementation.
profile_positions.title: Program Advisor a.i.

profile_positions.description: As Organisation & Process Consultant I supported internal clients on optimalisation of their value chain. Through several steps I supported process owner and the actors in the chain to analyse the performance from different perspectives and to plan such that costs, client perspective, service level, time, risk, etc. are best in balance. From this responsibility I supported the design of both sales as support processes.
profile_positions.title: Organisation & Process Consultant

profile_positions.description: Introduction and leadership program with focus on different aspects of financial services, project management, team management and development of personal leadership skills.
profile_positions.title: Management trainee

volunteer_experiences.description: With 152 solar panels of the roof of the local swimming pool our cooperative with 17 members generates solar energy.
I participated in the parents association of the crèche of my children.
At the basketball club I was the trainer and coach of 3 different youth teams in consecutive seasons.
I used my knowledge of business administration for the benefit of our sports club.
In Ecuador I worked as a volunteer in projects of Nuevos Horizontes. One project was at an ecological farm. The other project was in the amazone jungle with a local community.
